titleStmt.title: A letter to a member of the high and honorable court of Parliament, concerning the British monarchy proving it not to be despotical and arbitrary, but limited and moderated by Parliamentary government, and the fundamental laws of the nation. And that the oath of allegiance is due to their most serene majesties, the present king and queen, notwithstanding any former oath made to the late king. Licens'd according to order.

publicationStmt.publisher: Sold by Randal Taylor near Stationers-Hall,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the Lambeth Palace Library, London.
